DataElement.preferredName: Patient Complete Patient Children's Oncology Group Institution Eligibility Determination Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The Yes/No response that indicates the patient meet eligibility requirement for participation in a clinical trial with regarding to completion of prior curative therapy at a COG institution.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Complete Patient Children's Oncology Group Institution Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._An NCI-supported clinical cooperative group formed by the merger of the four national pediatric cancer research organizations: the Children's Cancer Group, the Intergroup Rhabdomyosarcoma Study Group, the National Wilms Tumor Study Group, and the Pediatric Oncology Group. The primary objective of the organization is to conduct clinical trials of new therapies for childhood and adolescent cancer. COG develops and coordinates clinical trials conducted at the 238 member institutions that include cancer centers of all major universities and teaching hospitals throughout the U.S. and Canada, as well as sites in Europe and Australia. COG members include over 5000 cancer researchers._An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization._The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

Concepts.definition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

Property.preferredName: Complete Patient Children's Oncology Group Institution Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.:A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:An NCI-supported clinical cooperative group formed by the merger of the four national pediatric cancer research organizations: the Children's Cancer Group, the Intergroup Rhabdomyosarcoma Study Group, the National Wilms Tumor Study Group, and the Pediatric Oncology Group. The primary objective of the organization is to conduct clinical trials of new therapies for childhood and adolescent cancer. COG develops and coordinates clinical trials conducted at the 238 member institutions that include cancer centers of all major universities and teaching hospitals throughout the U.S. and Canada, as well as sites in Europe and Australia. COG members include over 5000 cancer researchers.:An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.:The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

Concepts.definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

An NCI-supported clinical cooperative group formed by the merger of the four national pediatric cancer research organizations: the Children's Cancer Group, the Intergroup Rhabdomyosarcoma Study Group, the National Wilms Tumor Study Group, and the Pediatric Oncology Group. The primary objective of the organization is to conduct clinical trials of new therapies for childhood and adolescent cancer. COG develops and coordinates clinical trials conducted at the 238 member institutions that include cancer centers of all major universities and teaching hospitals throughout the U.S. and Canada, as well as sites in Europe and Australia. COG members include over 5000 cancer researchers.

An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient completed curativ
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed curative therapy (surgery and/or radiation and/or chemotherapy) within past 6 months at a COG institution?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed curative therapy (surgery and/or radiation and/or chemotherapy) within past 12 months at a COG institution?
